Topic.Title: Check Out Microsoft Surface on Bestbuy on-line

Message.Msg: Microsoft Rumored To Deliver Three New Surface Tablets In 2013 Jordan #$%$ Monday, December 3rd, 2012 A relatively reliable MSFT tipster @MS_nerd recently tweeted that Redmond will release three new and distinct generations of the Surface tablet sometime in 2013. Ballmer recently said on a shareholders’ call that the company would never again let hardware or anything else stand as a barrier to innovation, admitting that Microsoft was late to the game (especially with the tablet). It only makes sense that they would go big with both Surface and Windows 8, making up for lost time with plenty of shapes and sizes. After all, the company bet a lot on the popularity of a brand-new Microsoft, complete with Metro, touch, and true entry into the hardware space. The first tablet is said to be an 8.6-inch Surface RT 2, running on a Qualcomm chipset instead of the NVIDIA Tegra 3 chip. The Microsoft Pro will allegedly upgrade to an 11.6-inch display with an unreleased AMD “Temash” APU, and a new Surface Book product will sport a hefty 14.6-inch display with a next-gen 22nm “Haswell” chip from Intel under the hood. It’s interesting that none of the new models have the same 10.6-inch screen size as current-generation Surface RT and Pro slates do. However, in our reviews, we felt the form factor was a bit awkward and larger than the tablet that currently dominates the large tablet space, the 9.7-inch iPad. And then there’s Amazon and Google’s 7- to 8-inch offerings, and Barnes & Noble, and we can’t forget the iPad Mini now, either. Microsoft is late to a very feisty and competitive game, and a big push is necessary. And so far Surface sales have been slow going. The breadth of the lineup also sounds plausible alongside rumors of a Surface phone, as DigiTimes recently reported that Microsoft has sent orders to Foxconn for a self-branded and Microsoft-designed Surface phone. Of course, it’ll still be a while. Though the tipster specified 2013, I wouldn’t expect to see new models in stores until the holidays next year.

Message.Title: Will Nvidia Increase the Dividend Each Quarter
Message.Msg: I remember when Microchip first started a dividend in 2003. The CEO said they were doing well and was confident about the company's future. Almost word for word of which Nvidia's CEO said in Nvember when he started a dividend at $0.75 per quarter. Microchip started their dividend in 2003 at $.035 per quarter. Prior to that it was considered a speculative stock play and a favorite of the day traders. Then Mcirochip shocked everyone and raised their dividend each and every quarter except for 2009 when they kept it flat. Today the dividend is $352 per quarter and all the traders are gone and it is a favorite of the growth and income mutual funds. Just saying

Message.Title: Good Stocks Rallied Today. nvda coat-tailed weakly.
Message.Msg: It was a curious little rally today, right boys? It sure was. Washington's ballooning budget deficit was not fixed. The Federal Government's debt cap was not lifted. The same politicians that previously voted for automatic tax increases on most Everything, changed their minds. Except for the Social Security Tax. For which each and every employee must now pay 2% more. Nevertheless, the market rallied. The Good semiconductor stocks had a huge day, of course. Yes boys, Huge. While the struggling, shrinking tech stocks -- like nvda -- coat-tailed weakly. Let's take a look at today's trading action, shall we? + 7.60% __ Rambus Inc. + 5.48% __ Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Ltd. + 5.42% __ Advancing Micro Devices + 5.40% __ Hewlett-Packard Company + 5.28% __ Dell Inc. + 5.09% __ Freescale Semiconductor, Ltd. + 5.03% __ Seagate Technology Public Limited Company + 4.67% __ QUALCOMM Incorporated + 4.60% __ Texas Instruments, Inc. + 4.57% __ Micron Technology Inc. + 4.11% __ Oracle Corporation + 4.10% __ The Entire PHLX Semiconductor Stock Average + 3.75% __ nvidia This is exactly how nvidia ends up the year Way behind it peer averages. Waaaay behind, boys. Like today -- it's already .35% Behind the PHLX Semiconductor Stock Average. On just the first (1st) trading day of 2013. Enjoy your weakly coat-tailing "investment".

Topic.Title: Hey Daytraders..You Guys Just don't get it Nvidia is a Growth and Income Stock

Message.Msg: Much more to come. Once Tech CEO's realize that their Restricted Stock units collect dividends too. They start thinking..."Hey the business is looking good and I don't need all this cash on the books earning nothing. The cash flow is great. Let's buy back a little stock and raise the dividend every quarter. TJ Rodgers laughed 2 quarters when an analyst questioned him about Cypress Semi's dividend policy and said...Hey cash flow is great business is in a little slow period so I raised the dividend so I now collect $3M a year after tax. By the way I can live very well on that and the company is still investing for the next upswing which should come in the 1Q of 2014." Microchip tech does the same. Shareholders love it, Day traders hate it because 95% of the shares end up in growth and income funds who just play the semi cycle and don't even read the Tout Sheet Website articles. Yes...We all love the dividend Jen Hsung!!!!
